name: Easy Swedish Meatball Sauce
briefdescription: This quick and easy Swedish meatball sauce turns frozen meatballs into tonight's main attraction. Serve on top of noodles or rice alongside a green salad for the perfect meal.

ingredients: 0.5 teaspoon ground black pepper, or more to taste
0.5 teaspoon dried rosemary, crushed, or more to taste

instructions: Whisk together stock, cream, flour, soy sauce, 1/2 teaspoon pepper, and 1/2 teaspoon rosemary in a large saucepan over low heat until smooth. Cook, stirring occasionally, until thickened, about 10 minutes.

Stir in thawed meatballs, and continue cooking until meatballs are heated through, about 5 more minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center of the meatballs should read at least 160 degrees F (71 degrees C).
Taste and adjust seasonings before serving.

comments.comment: This was delicious and quick. I didn’t have black pepper so I used Cajun seasoning. It had a nice flavor.
